approach.label: Our Process
approach.title: One complete process, one mission
approach.subtitle: From initial audit to final admission, we guide every step of your child's application.

s1.title: Positioning & Profile
s1.desc: Application audit, distinctive "spike" identification, profile engineering. We define what will make your child memorable among 40,000 applicants.

s2.title: Narrative & Essays
s2.desc: Personal statement, supplemental essays, activities list. We build a coherent narrative where every experience, every commitment takes on its full meaning.

s3.title: Tests & Academic Excellence
s3.desc: SAT/ACT preparation, academic record optimization, course selection. Our students' average SAT score: 1520.

s4.title: Interviews & Management
s4.desc: Interview coaching, strategic university selection, recommendation letters, deadline tracking. We manage the process from A to Z.

admissions.title: Admission Strategy
admissions.desc: Curriculum preparation, international applications, narrative strategy, interview coaching. Multi-zone strategy: Ivy League, Oxbridge, Polytechnique, EPFL.

testimonials.label: Testimonials
testimonials.title: Hear from our students
testimonials.subtitle: Discover authentic feedback from our students and their parents

review_sarah.quote: Greg has been working with Max since 9th grade. It started just to bring up his math grades, then he quickly took over the bigger picture — course choices, specializations, the application. We honestly didn't think Louis-le-Grand was within reach. Max starts there in September.
review_sarah.name: Sarah K.

review_marie.quote: We started working with Greg in 10th grade, mostly math and physics. EPFL was the goal but honestly it felt like a long shot. He structured everything over two years — the courses, the application, all of it. When I got the answer I could barely believe it. Without him I wouldn't even have applied.
review_marie.name: Julien M.

review_thomas.quote: 780 on the SAT math section and a targeted admission strategy. Greg guided me from course selection to essay preparation. Admitted to UPenn early decision.
review_thomas.name: Thomas B.

about_preview.label: The Founder
about_preview.title: Greg Mittelette
about_preview.quote_translation: We don't learn for school, but for life.
about_preview.text: Over 1,600 students mentored. 80% admitted to a top 30 global university or grande ecole. Our edge: we know the final destination — Stanford, Polytechnique, EPFL — which lets us build the right path from day one.

q1.question: What commitment does this require from the family?
q1.answer: Serious mentoring is teamwork. We expect consistency in sessions, transparency on transcripts and goals, and real parent involvement in orientation decisions. In return, we commit to personalized follow-up and genuine availability between sessions.

q2.question: When should we start?
q2.answer: The earlier, the better. Ideally 6th-7th grade: we build the math foundations, choose the right curriculum, anticipate the key transitions. But we also work with students who come in during 11th or 12th grade — the work is different, more intensive, but the results are there.

q3.question: How many students do you take on?
q3.answer: Few. We follow each student personally, sometimes over several years. It's not a scalable model and that's by design. If we're full, we'll tell you — we'd rather say no than do it halfway.

q4.question: What does the process look like?
q4.answer: We start with a diagnostic: current level, ambitions, target schools. From there we propose a work plan. Sessions are weekly, in person or via video. We check in regularly with parents and adjust based on results and deadlines.

q5.question: Do you work with families abroad?
q5.answer: Most of our clients are expats or between two countries. We work via video with families in Dubai, Singapore, London, New York. French system, AEFE schools, IB, BFI — we know these curricula and more importantly, how they translate in admissions files.

alumni.label: Community
alumni.title: They went through Carmine
alumni.subtitle: Each student joins a network of alumni admitted to the world's top institutions.

thomas.name: Thomas B.
thomas.start: 10th grade at Lycee International. Good student, 14/20 in math. No admissions strategy. Expat family with no reference points on the American system.
thomas.strategy: Math and physics reinforcement over 2 years. Targeted SAT prep (result: 780 math). Built a "spike" around scientific research. Narrative strategy centered on his international background.
thomas.outcome: SAT 1540. Admitted to UPenn early decision. Also accepted at McGill and King's College London.

julien.name: Julien M.
julien.start: 10th grade at Lycee International de Saint-Germain. Solid but inconsistent STEM profile. EPFL was a dream, not a plan.
julien.strategy: Deep work on math and physics over 2 years. Stabilized results. Strategic choice of specializations. EPFL application built around scientific profile and personal projects.
julien.outcome: Strong application, admitted to EPFL. Now in first year in Lausanne.

max.name: Max K.
max.start: 9th grade at EJM. Declining math grades, confidence shaken. The family wasn't thinking about elite prep schools.
max.strategy: Rebuilt math foundations. Worked on method and rigor. Guided specialization choices. Progressive orientation toward elite prep schools, built the Louis-le-Grand application.
max.outcome: Grades went from 11 to 17 in math. Admitted to Louis-le-Grand MPSI. The family couldn't believe it.

footer.desc: Elite admissions specialist: Ivy League, Stanford, Polytechnique, EPFL, Oxbridge. Strategic guidance for ambitious families.

thank_you.title: Thank you!
thank_you.text: Your message has been sent. We will get back to you within 24 hours.

about.title: The Founder
about.subtitle: "Non scholae, sed vitae discimus" – Seneca
about.bio_text1: Paris-Saclay for math, Centrale Lyon for engineering, UPenn. I saw from the inside how admissions actually work. Who gets in, who doesn't, and why.
about.bio_text2: The most invested families are often the most misguided. They pay for tutoring, stack extracurriculars, hope the grades will speak for themselves. Meanwhile, the spots go to those who understood the rules of the game.
about.bio_text3: For 12 years, I've been bridging those two worlds. From 6th grade to the gates of Stanford, Polytechnique, EPFL. Not by teaching math. By building a strategy: which curriculum, which timeline, which positioning — so that on decision day, the application leaves no doubt.
about.bio_text4: 1,600 students. The reality hasn't changed: when you know where you're going, every decision becomes obvious.
about.philosophy_text1: I take on few students. That's a choice. Because my job is to know each one of them — their transcripts, their strengths, what they hide, what holds them back.
about.philosophy_text2: I follow them over the long run. Sometimes from 6th grade to the moment they open the letter. When I build an application for Stanford, Oxford or Ginette, I'm not taking a guess — I know what separates a yes from a no.
about.philosophy_text3: I live internationally, like most of my clients. We understand each other because we share the same reality: an ambition for our children, opaque systems, and the refusal to leave it to chance.
about.philosophy_text4: Today, I'm preparing my own children, aged 9 and 11, exactly the way I prepare my students. Same rigor, same vision. That's the most honest proof of what I believe in.

admissions.label: Admissions Consulting
admissions.title: From academic excellence to the gates of the world's elite institutions
admissions.subtitle: Multi-zone strategy: Ivy League, Oxbridge, Polytechnique, EPFL, elite prepas
admissions.intro_text: Getting into Stanford, Oxford or Polytechnique demands far more than perfect grades. We transform your potential into a singular, memorable application through a proven narrative and scientific strategy, adapted to each admission system.

item1.title: Profile Audit
item1.desc: Complete evaluation of academic background: transcripts, class rank, strengths and areas for improvement.

item2.title: Curriculum Building
item2.desc: Strategic advice on advanced course selection (AP, IB, Honors) to maximize perceived academic rigor.

item3.title: "Spike" Development
item3.desc: Identifying a unique academic niche or passion to stand out among thousands of "perfect" candidates.

item1.title: Expert Math / Physics Mentoring
item1.desc: Intensive preparation to guarantee the top grades required for elite applications.

item2.title: Standardized Test Preparation
item2.desc: SAT / ACT strategies and coaching to reach the 75th percentile of target universities.

item1.title: Personal Statement
item1.desc: Brainstorming and crafting an authentic, powerful narrative that reveals your personality.

item2.title: Supplemental Essays
item2.desc: Fine-tuning your voice to meet the specific expectations of each institution (Stanford, Yale, Harvard, etc.).

item3.title: Activities Optimization
item3.desc: Strategic showcasing of your extracurricular involvement and proof of leadership.

item1.title: Intensive Mock Interviews
item1.desc: Practice with evaluation rubrics modeled on those used by admissions officers.

item2.title: Oral Storytelling
item2.desc: Turn every answer into an opportunity to demonstrate your "intellectual vitality".

item1.title: University List Selection
item1.desc: Strategic balancing of "Reach", "Match" and "Safety schools" to maximize your chances.

item2.title: Letters of Recommendation
item2.desc: Coaching to identify and guide teachers who can write outstanding support letters.

item3.title: 100% Digital Support
item3.desc: Maximum responsiveness through video format, adapted to international students and demanding schedules.
